p: Two new tirucallane-type triterpenoids, namely congoensin A ( 165) and congoensin B ( 166), along with the known tirucallane-type triterpenoid gladoral A ( 167) (Fig. 34) were isolated from the bark of Entandrophragma congoënse (Meliaceae) harvested from Cameroon by Happi et al. [ 105]. These compounds exhibited activities against the NF54 strain with IC 50 values ranging from 2.4 to 6.1 µM [ 105].
